loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is fifty-two years old, married to Rose, and they have two children who are in school.

Joseph is a farmer and has applied for his sixth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for the farm.

He hopes to venture into the cattle rearing business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Dovya Group

texts.en:
Shukuru, who is in her late thirties is married with one child who is also married. She has been running a beauty salon for 20 years now.  She works from 9.00 am to 7.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the equipment in her salon, renovate the salon by painting the inside, repair the floor by putting down tiles and installing a washing sink, and pay household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase the equipment in the salon and to pay the rent. Her dream is to one day be able to modify her house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "DOVYA" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase equipment in the salon and to pay the rent for the salon.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa is a 25-year-old married lady. She has been working in her beauty salon for the last three years and she is planning to enhance the salon by adding new services and renewing the decoration. But now Randa has applied for a loan to renew the salon’s official registration.

loans.use: to renew the salon’s official registration.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa, 46 years old, is a widow. She was left with six sons and daughters to support. Sharifa started making baskets from straw to sell to support her family. It has been six years since she started and now she wants to start selling additional products such as home products to increase the family income. Therefore, she has applied for a loan to buy the goods she wants to sell.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Sicily

texts.en:
Sicily is a resident of Murang’a  and lives with her young family of two children aged eleven and two. She is twenty-eight and has been involved actively in farming for eighteen years. She farms coffee, tea, maize and horticultural products for the local market.

Sicily has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her cereals business by buying pesticides and expanding her store. She adds she will later use the income to buy more land to further improve her farming to include other products that can withstand harsh weather conditions.

She laments of high costs of pesticides to keep the produce safe.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and expand her cereals store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a married father of a nine-year-old, lives in Murang’a, Central Kenya where he has been farming and producing coffee, maize, beans and milk for five years, employing one farmhand. All of his products, save for a small amount of milk consumed by his family, is sold to the local market. Lack of capital and dry spells are his major business challenges.

Peter has requested a loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the resulting additional income will improve his family's living standard. His goal is to have five dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 37-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married with 6 children between the ages of 2 and 17. Four of them go to school. 

Felix runs a mixed goods' store and he has been in the business for 5 years. He has no employees. Felix heard about Finance Sudan through its fellow clients, as well promotion done in the market by the loan officers.

He is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase more items like sugar, sweets, nomi, cooking oil and many other items. In addition to this business, Felix has a motorcycle used for bodaboda as another source of income.

In 5 years' time, Felix would like to build a better house and increase his number of motorcycles to two. His major challenges include a low income rate and paying school fees. 
 
Felix says that he really appreciated Finance South Sudan for the good work done and its work should not end; it should continue.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, sweets, nomi, and cooking oil

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be an intelligent woman. She operates a farm where she sells peas, potatoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more seeds for planting before March season comes. Lilian's business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
Peng, a responsible mother of three lovely young children, lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is a pig-raiser and has a life partner who works as a public school teacher in a local high school.

Peng is preparing to construct her house but needs some funds from our firm, HKL, to supplement her existing capital to purchase timber for the construction. This will be her fifth loan with HKL and her first with Kiva. She hopes to get a quick response from our lenders. She is an honest client who repays her loans regularly and punctually. All previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: to purchase timber for house construction.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a conservative person, so she has asked her brother-in-law to take her place in the photo. Abeer, 26 years old, is a housewife and a mother of three children.

Her husband has a trading business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. Recently, he has built a tent for selling those fruits and vegetables. His wife Abeer has applied for a loan to help her husband expanding the business and build more tents in other places.

loans.use: to build more tents

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha, 43 years old and married, has five children. She is married to Mohammad who is a police officer. After she retired from working in a telecommunications company, Maha has started to make different shaped baskets, trays and even tables using straw. She has applied for a loan to buy more material needed for the crafts she makes so she can increase her productivity and therefore increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make crafts

loans.name: Adita

texts.es:
Adita, de 29 años de edad, es una joven mujer luchadora y trabajadora, no le teme al trabajo y tiene muchas ilusiones para su futuro. Es separada del padre de sus 2 hijos: María y Santiago de 10 y 5 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente la casa de su madre en compañía de su mamá y su papá. La actividad que realiza Adita es la elaboración y venta de esteras que sirven para las divisiones y paredes de las casas, hechos  a base de desperdicios de triplay. Cuenta con un local alquilado donde tiene todos los materiales necesarios para el proceso de elaboración, además de personal que le ayuda que son 3 ayudantes a quienes paga por día trabajado. Luego los vende a base de pedidos al por mayor y menor, atendiendo puntual y amablemente a sus clientes.
 Se inició hace más de 5 años con un capital propio  que fue reinvirtiendo, y hasta el momento le apoya su hermana en la administración y consiguiendo nuevos  clientes.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda y las buenas ganancias que le deja ya que cuenta con varios pedidos por entregar.
Decidió empezar con su negocio por el deseo de ser independiente y contar con sus propios ingresos económicos, además que le ayudó cuando se separó de su pareja y no contaba con su apoyo para asumir los gastos de sus hijos, logrando luego que le diera una pensión para sus hijos.
En la actualidad, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, quiere continuar con su negocio y aumentar su producción. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Esta agradecida de contar con una línea de crédito, podrá sentirse más segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además comenta estar contenta con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1300 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus esteras, como desperdicios de triplay que compra en las fábricas cercanas, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Adita, 29, is a hard-working young woman.  She's not afraid of work and has high hopes for her future.  She is separated from the father of her 2 children, Maria, 10, and Santiago, 5.  Adita and her children live with her father and mother.  Adita operates a business making and selling plyboard dividers.  Customers use the dividers to create temporary walls.  She rents a space where she makes the dividers and hires day laborers to help.  She sells to both wholesalers and retailers and she's committed to delivering all orders on time.  Adita used her own money to start the business 5 years ago.  Her sister helps her with admistrative work and sales, and the business is now profitable.
Adita decided to start the business because she wanted an income of her own and she needed the business to support her children when she separated from her husband.  She wants to grow the business now.  
Adita has borrowed from MFP once before and she is grateful to the bank for helping her grow her business.  She tells us that she likes her community bank and that its members are responsible and supportive.  
Adita will use this 1300 new soles loan to buy wholesale supplies of  materials for making the product she sells.

loans.use: to buy materials for making plyboard dividers.

loans.name: Luzdina

texts.es:
Luzdina, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ansias de progresar, además es alegre y sociable, le gustan los negocios. Es separada del padre de sus 4 hijos que son: Rocío de 22, Nara de 20, Mayra de 16 y Christian de 14 años de edad. Todos instalados cómodamente en su propia casa que compró con mucho esfuerzo.
La actividad que realiza Luzdina es la venta de pescado fresco por las  mañanas, empieza por las madrugadas dirigiéndose al puesto de la localidad a comprar su mercadería de los pescadores, luego los lleva a su puesto de venta en el mercado Bellavista, donde los prepara y vende, atendiendo muy bien a sus clientes sabiendo que de esa manera le seguirán comprando en el futuro.
Se inició hace más de 4 años con un capital propio, viendo que un trabajo de fácil realización y bastante demanda, viendo rotar  y aumentar su capital de manera diaria ya que generalmente  acaba lo que lleva para la venta y hasta el momento le apoyan ocasionalmente sus hijas mayores en la ventas..
Antes de iniciar su negocio, tenía problemas económicos ya que  se había separado del padre de sus hijos y con la necesidad de tener un ingreso económico ya que con la pensión que recibía por sus hijas no les alcanzaba, entonces  se decidió a empezar a vender.
Viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, espera  ver crecer su negocio, aumentando su capital. Este será el préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida por saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de pescado fresco en mayor volumen y buscando menos precios. Además de realizar arreglos en su casa para abrir otro negocio de una bodega de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Forty-one year old Luzdina, is a woman who eagerly wants to progress in her life, furthermore she is happy and sociable and likes running a business. She is separated from the father of her four children who are: Rocío, 22; Nara, 20; Mayra, 16 and Christian, 14; All of them live comfortably in her house, which she bought with much effort.

Luzdina sells fresh fish in the mornings. She starts at daybreak, by going to the fish market to buy directly from the fishermen. Later, she takes the fish to her own fish stand in the Bellavista market, where she prepares them for sale. She gives her customers very good service, knowing that in this way, they will keep buying from her in the future. 

She began more than four years ago with her own capital, seeing that it would be easy to start and that there was enough demand. Seeing the rotation and increasing her capital each day, because she generally sells what she brings to the market and up til now, her oldest daughters occasionally help her in the market. Before she started her business, she had economic problems because she had separated from the father of her children and needed to have an income because the pension she received for her children was not enough, so she decided to start selling fish.

Seeing the good results she has had, she hopes to grow her business and increase her capital. This is will be her seventh loan with MFP. She is grateful to know that she can count on the financial support to advance her business plans. On the other hand, she feels comfortable with her communal bank and she considers it a unified and supportive group. The loan requested is 3,000 nuevos soles and she will invest it in the purchase of wholesale fresh fish and will seek it for lower prices. Furthermore, she would like to arrange her house to be able to open another business, a grocery store.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 14 years. He describes himself to be ambitious, energetic and generous. He operates a business where he provides vehicle repairs. He has been involved in this business for 16 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are drivers and vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of spare parts. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more spare parts. Paul's business goal and dream is to own 3 motor vehicles within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for vehicle repair business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. She operates a retail store where she sells motor vehicle spare parts. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located near a bus station and her primary customers are drivers and vehicle owners. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of spare parts, making it difficult to meet her customers' needs. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more spare parts. Susan's business dream and hope is to run another spare parts' retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: 3.9.131.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Điệp Dương operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Điệp Dương is 38 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the 3.9.131.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Điệp Dương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, she hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her child to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada, además de ser amable y sociable. Está casada con Acsel quien es empleado y es padre de sus 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad. Juntos habitan su propia casa en compañía de su suegro. La actividad que realiza María es el alquiler de juegos de entretenimiento para adultos como el billar, para eso cuenta con un local habilitado en su propia casa, donde tiene 4 mesas disponibles. Iniciándose por idea de su pareja y con un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros. Tiene más de 1 año dedicándose a éste negocio, contando con el apoyo de su suegro en la atención a los clientes de manera amable y cordial. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera  los ingresos económicos necesarios para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, además de sentirse una persona productiva. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene, pues le llega a faltar mesas. Por eso, tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y comprar al menos 2 mesas más, además que incluir otro negocio de venta de comidas rápidas. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues le gusta el trabajo que viene realizando, brindando oportunidad de créditos a las personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos, soles lo invertirá en la compra de algunas mesas más para generarse más ingresos económicos, además de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Maria, 36 years old, is a hard-working and dedicated woman, who, in addition, is very nice and sociable. She is married to Acsel who is employed and is the father of their 2 children, aged 11 and 8. They live in their own house with her father-in-law.

Maria's activity is renting out entertainment games such as billiards to adults. To do this, she has furnished a room in her house in which there are now 4 available tables. The idea was her husband's and she started with capital drawn from their savings. She has had the business for a little more than 1 year, with help from her father-in-law who attends to customers in a kind and cordial way.

Maria likes her business, which generates income necessary to help the couple with household expenses, and it makes her feel like a productive person. She considers her business sufficiently profitable, thanks to demand, but she needs more tables. For that reason, Maria plans to expand her business and buy at least 2 more tables, and also, to include another business selling quick meals.

This will be her 5th loan through MFP, and she hopes with this collaboration, to continue towards her objectives. Besides, she comments that she feels good about her communal bank, and she likes the work that it continues to achieve, offering opportunities for loans to individuals. With the solicited amount of 1,500 new sols, she will buy more billiard tables to generate more earnings, plus the ingredients for preparing quick meals to sell.

loans.use: to buy more billiard tables plus ingredientes to begin making and selling quick meals.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 4 years. She describes herself to be a self-motivated woman. She operates a motorcycle, which she uses to provide motorcycle transportation services. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a potential business environment and her primary customers are office employees and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor infrastructure. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts. Miriam's business goal and hope is to own several motorcycles within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: 07-Pt2-01-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liễu has a service business providing housing rentals. She is requesting a loan to purchase bricks, lime, and building houses for rent.

Liễu is 48 years old and she is married with 4 children. Liễu is the group leader of the 07-PT2-02-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. 

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2011, Liễu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liễu has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Liễu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Liễu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liễu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, lime, and building houses for rent

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is 28 years old and she lives in Airport community. She stopped her education in the 2nd grade. She is married and has two children, aged 3 and 6. One is not in school, while the older one attends school and both of them live at home. She received money from her husband to start her business. For 10 years now, Felecia has been operating a mini-shop where she sells soap, rice, toothpaste and many other items. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, soap, toothpaste, and many items for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soap, toothpaste, and many items for her business

loans.name: 07-Pt3-03-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicken, duck, spices and vegetables for making the soup she sells. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Hoa is 49 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 07-PT3-03-Phú Sơn solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependents. With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, duck, spices and vegetables for making the soup she sells.

loans.name: 07-Pt2-05-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Ms. Sáu has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase candy and biscuits to resell. Sáu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Sáu is 63 years old and she is single with 4 children. She is the group leader of the 07-PT2-05-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2011, Sáu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Sáu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase candy and biscuits to resell.

loans.name: Siphan

texts.en:
Siphon and her husband, Chantha Heng, both age 43, live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and one daughter. Two are garment workers and the youngest is in school. 

Siphan is a homemaker. The main source of income comes from the salaries earned by her husband and children. Her husband is a soldier. 

She is asking for a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike to serve as transportation for her son to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to get work

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: Amparo, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y empeñosa, buscando salir adelante. Está casada con Ronald quien es empleado y padre de sus 3 hijos de 18, 12 y 2 años de edad. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Ampara es la venta de comidas rápidas como pollos broster, alitas fritas, salchipapas y otros.  Para esto instala todas las noches en el frontis de su casa su carrito sanguchero más dos mesas con sus sillas, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, ganándose sus preferencias. Tiene más de 6 años dedicándose a éste negocio contando con el apoyo de su hija mayor en la atención a los clientes. Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos, además de gustarle la cocina, y el poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por tanto, tiene planes en continuar con su negocio e incursionar en la venta de pollo a la brasa abriendo un local alquilado. Este será el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que vienen recibiendo para avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comida rápida como aceites, harina, pollos entre otros, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras al contado.
texts.en: Amparo, who is 39 years old, is a determined and hard-working woman, looking to get ahead.  She is married to Ronald, who is employed and the father of their 3 children who are 18, 12, and 2 years old.  They live comfortably together in their own home.  Amparo works in the sales of fast foods like broasted chicken, fried wings, "salchipapas" [fried hot dogs and french fries], and other things.  She sets up her cart every night in front of her house along with two tables with their chairs, where she attends very nicely to her customers, making their orders.  She has more than 6 years of experience in this business, counting on her eldest daughter's support in serving the customers.  She likes her business because of the economic income.  Furthermore, she likes the kitchen, and having the ability to support her husband with the household costs.  She thinks that her business is fairly profitable because of the good earnings that it gives her.  As such, she has plans to continue with her business and to begin selling grilled chicken, opening a rented location.  This will be her 11th loan with the MFP institution.  Therefore, she expects their collaboration so that she can finalize her plans.  Besides, she mentions feeling pleased with her communal bank because of the support that they receive to advance with their business.  With the amount requested of 1000 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare the fast food such as oil, flour, chicken, and other items,  looking for the lowest prices for her cash purchases.

loans.use: buy oils, flour, and chicken meat.

loans.name: Ruqaya

texts.en:
Ruqaya is a conservative person so she has asked her brother Mohammad to take her place in the photo.

Ruqaya is 30 years old and single. She works with her brother in a tailoring workshop to support the family and help in improving their living conditions. Ruqaya has applied for a loan to buy more fabric to sell and to use in making clothes and other items.

loans.use: to buy more fabric

loans.name: 07-Pt2-06-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Ms. Đậu works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to raise and resell.

Đậu is 52 years old and she is single with 4 children. Đậu is the group leader of the 07-PT2-06-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2011, Đậu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Đậu has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Đậu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Đậu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Đậu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise and resell

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 34-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother with two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a worker who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past five years, Hala has a workshop for tailoring clothes. She is well-known to customers and the owners of clothing stores, which helped her to have a profitable project for the family.

Hala is requesting a $1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing needed textiles and threads to tailor clothes that customers request. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. 

Hala is photographed in her workshop while she is tailoring.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and threads

loans.name: 07-Pt2-08-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoan has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase cloth to sew clothes for people in her community. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Ngoan is 32 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the 07-PT2-08-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 9 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent. With her business profit, Ngoan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sew clothes for her community.

loans.name: 07-Pt3-02-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicken, duck and fruit to resell. She is 39 years old and she is married with 2 children. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Thủy is the group leader of the 07-PT3-02-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependents. With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: To purchase chicken, duck and fruit to resell.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Yet, age 51, pictured here at her home, is a widow with two sons. She lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. One son is a garment worker and the other attends school.

Yet is a rice farmer. She is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her son, who is a garment worker, to get to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son, who is a garment worker, to get to work

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es:
Lleny, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora que le gusta el trabajo, además de ser alegre y sociable. Es conviviente con Juan quien es comerciante y padre de sus 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, Katherine, Junior, Fiorella, de 19, 16 y 8  años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa que  compraron con el fruto de su esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Lleny es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de variados sabores y marcas, haciéndolas helar al gusto de sus clientes, para eso cuenta con un refrigeradora que compró con un préstamo y la instaló en su casa, desde allí  los atiende de manera amable y cordial, sabiendo que con ese trato se ganara la preferencia de sus clientes. 
Se inició con un préstamo de MFP, que le sirvió para realizar sus primeras compras, viendo la acogida que tuvo su negocio y con las ganancias que le dejaba los reinvirtió logrando comprar en mayores cantidades, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y por el consumo constante de las bebidas por lo caluroso de la zona.
Antes de empezar con su negocio, nos comenta que no tenía problemas, pero si el deseo de contar con una ocupación que la distrajera, además como contar con sus propios ingresos, así apoyar a su pareja con los gastos y no depender totalmente de él.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y aumentar su mercadería para ver crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero, así se sentirá más segura para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, comenta le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal que viene apoyando a las personas con una línea de crédito para concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su mercadería para tener un stock disponible para la venta, así ver crecer su negocio, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Lleny, 43, is a friendly, hard-working woman.  She and her partner, Juan, have 4 children, 3 of whom still live at home: Katherine, 19, Junion, 16, and Firorella, 8.  They live in a house that they worked hard to build.  Lleny operates a business buying and selling all kinds of soft drinks.  She keeps the drinks in a refrigerator that she bought to keep them cold.  Her customers want cold drinks and she provides them.  She's friendly and cordial because her customers want that too.  
Lleny started the business with an MFP loan and it was successful from the start.  She then used her profits to buy larger quantities of soft drinks.  She runs the business alone and says that it's profitable.  There's a lot of demand for cold drinks here because of the hot climate.
Lleny says that she didn't have any particular reason for starting the business.  She wanted something to do and a way to help her partner with household expenses.  She likes having an income of her own, though, and she wants to grow the business now.  
This will be Lleny's 11th MFP loan and she is grateful to the bank for helping her grow her business.  She tells us that she likes her community bank because they help borrowers turn their plans into reality.  
Lleny will use this 2500 new soles loan to buy wholesale supplies of soft drinks for her drinks business.

loans.use: to stock her soft drinks business.

loans.name: Yaseen

texts.en:
Yaseen is 39 years old and married. He has two daughters and his wife is a housewife. 

Fourteen years ago, Yaseen opened a small grocery store and has worked on enhancing it through the years. Now Yaseen has applied for a loan in order to bring all types of necessary grocery items to the store so the customer can find everything he wants in the store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Noura

texts.en: Noura is a 55-year-old illiterate woman who works in a school. Her husband owns a small grocery store. Noura has applied for a loan to help in supporting her husband’s business so he can fill the store with more grocery items to attract and serve more customers in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to fill the store with more grocery items

loans.name: 07-Pt2-04-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hợp has a manufacturing business [Xin điền vào mục đích vay]. She is requesting a loan to purchase plastic to produce furniture for wholesalers, and also to buy fish and vegetables. Hợp has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is 36 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the 07-PT2-04-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent. 

In 2011, Hợp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Hợp hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase plastic to produce furniture for wholesalers, and to buy fish and vegetables.

loans.name: 04.05.03-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung has a retail business selling dry food and other goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food and goods to resell, such as processed seafood, sugar, salt, fish sauce, etc. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Dung is 68 years old and she is married with 6 children. She lives in an urban area of Thanh Hoa city with no dependents. She is the group leader of the 04.05.03-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. In 2007, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and goods to resell, such as processed seafood, sugar, salt, fish sauce, etc.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol, age 33, and his wife Sineth, age 37, live in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1998 and have three sons and a daughter. Three of the children attend school and one stays at home.   

Pol is a chef. He cooks for wedding parties and other occasions. His wife sells vegetables, transporting them to her customers via motorbike, but the vehicle is old and breaks down often. For this reason, Pol has decided to ask for a loan in the amount of $1,200 in order to buy a new motorbike for his wife.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for his wife's vegetable vending business.

loans.name: Bunthan

texts.en:
Bunthan (in the photo) is 29 years old and his wife, Sopheaktra (who is 25 years old), have been married since 2008 and they have just one young daughter. They live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Bunthan and his wife produce rice wine and raise pigs at home. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase pig feed and buy more rice to make rice wine.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and buy more rice to make rice wine

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha (in the photo), age 22, is single. She has full-time employment selling clothes in Phnom Penh City. Because her homeland is about 25 kilometers away from Phnom Penh, she decided to rent a house to stay in Phnom Penh with her sister. 

Chantha is asking for her first loan of $1,000 USD to buy a motorbike to get to work because she commutes to work by taking motor taxi. With the motorcycle, which she will buy with money from the loan, Chantha will be able to save some money by not spending it on motor taxis or she can go to her homeland some weekends. She will also use a part of the loan to build a restroom for family use.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to get to work and build a restroom for family use

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha (in the photo), age 46, is a widow without any children. She lives with her mother in a suburb, about 25 kilometres away from Phnom Penh.
 
Sitha is a tailor. She is requesting her first loan in the amount of $600 USD to build a fence around her house, which will protect her elements and things.

loans.use: to build a fence around her house

loans.name: Floripes

texts.es:
Floripes, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial. Es conviviente con Guillermo quien se dedica a la docencia y es padre de sus 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 12 años de edad. Juntos habitan su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Floripes es la venta de ropas de damas, caballeros y niños que le envía su prima de la ciudad de Lima por campañas festivas,  también cuenta con un salón de belleza donde brinda servicios de cortes, tintes entre otros. Aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional,  brinda una buena atención tanto en la venta como en el servicio a sus clientes, ganándose su preferencia. Tiene más de 2 años dedicándose a estos negocios y hasta el momento lo realiza ella sola.
Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos encomios, el tener una oficio y sentirse un persona productiva, deseando ser una prospera empresaria, además el poder estar en casa y cuidar de sus hijos. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene  y las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por eso, tiene planes de ampliar su salón de belleza y convertirlo en un spa brindando un servicio más variado. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que vienen brindando a las personas con una oportunidad de contar con líneas de créditos. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles los invertirá en la comprar de materiales para su salón de belleza como tintes, cremas, entre otros, además del arreglo de su piso y paredes.
texts.en:
Floripes, thirty-four years old, in addition to being likeable and friendly, is a persevering and hard-working woman. She lives with Guillermo, who is a teacher and the father of her three children. Her children are sixteen, fourteen, and twelve years old. They live together in their own home, which they purchased after lots of effort. Floripes sells women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing which her cousin sends from Lima for the different festivals. She also has a beauty salon where she offers services such as hair-cutting and dyeing, among others. She learned these skills by studying at an occupational education center. She is attentive in both sales and customer service, which earns her repeat customers. She has spent more than two years working in these businesses, and up until now has been working by herself.
She likes her business because of the economic return it provides her, the benefit of having a trade, and the feeling it gives her of being a productive person. She hopes to be able to spend more time at home to take care of her children and also to be a prosperous businesswoman. She considers her business to be reasonably profitable due to the demand for it and the good profits it provides her. As a result, she has plans to expand her beauty salon and convert it into a health spa, offering other services. This will be her third loan with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma], and she is looking forward to working with MFP to be able to realize her plans. Additionally, she feels good about her communal bank due to the support which it continues to offer folks, providing them with an opportunity to benefit from a line of credit. She will invest the 1200 PEN [$450] she has requested by purchasing materials for her beauty salon, such as dyes and creams, among others, in addition to fixing the floor and walls.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, creams, and beauty products, in addition to materials to fix the floor of her property.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Almuminun 1 Group

texts.en:
Siti is married with four children. Two of them are still schooling. She has been selling daily basic needs such as rice, eggs, oil, and sugar for five years from a store in her house. The business is going well and she needs more inventory to sell. Now she is taking a loan from VisionFund Indonesia to buy more rice, eggs, oil, sugar and other inventory to sell. She wants her children to have a better education than she has. At least her children can finish high school. In the future, she hopes her store can grow and sell more variety of things. 

Other group members are using their part of the loan to sell nasi uduk (Indonesian coconut rice) and to sell fried snacks.

loans.use: to pay for more rice, eggs, oil, sugar and other supplies to sell

loans.name: Bendungan Melayu Group

texts.en: Ruwanti is married. She has been selling fried rice for five years. She sells it in front of her house from a cart. Her business is going well and she can help her husband who works as a labor to create income. She is taking a loan from VisionFund Indonesia to repair her cart to continue selling fried rice. In the future, she wants to expand her fried rice business. She hopes someday she can repair her house.

loans.use: to pay for repairing her cart to sell fried rice

loans.name: 06.03.05 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Lan is applying for a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future. She works in agriculture, farming and raising poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Lan faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Lan is 42 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 06.03.05- Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2010, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Lan hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise

loans.name: Koey

texts.en:
Koey is 39 years old and living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. She is married with four children depending on her income. She presently has been raising some pigs in a wooden pigpen as a micro family-owned business to share her responsibility for the family.

Koey would like to borrow some funds from HKL, a longstanding MFI in Cambodia, to purchase timbers for her house’s construction and to pay for the labor cost. She hopes to have her house done immediately. She is very appreciative of our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase timbers for her house’s construction and to pay for the labor cost.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn (in the photo) is 29 years old and her husband, Ros, is 32 years old. They have been married since 2003 and they have a young daughter. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 15 kilometres away. 

Korn and her husband are garment workers. She is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to get to work

loans.name: Nut

texts.en:
Nut is 42 years old and is one of the residents who has been residing in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Her daily business is to sell pork through the commune from her bicycle. She is married and blessed with four children attending school.

Presently Nut is preparing to start constructing her house. However, Nut needs some additional construction supplies to have it done. So now Nut decided to take out some funds from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to purchase timbers for this construction. Nut hopes to have a suitable house for comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase timbers to construct her house

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem is a 37-year-old married woman who works on the rice field as a rice cultivator from Pouk district, Siem Reap province. She has been engaged in this type of business since 2000. Besides farming, Chhem is also operating a selling business from a small store to generate extra income. Chhem has 2 school-aged children who depend on her.

Chhem would like to borrow some funds from HKL to purchase a piece of farmland to improve her farming business. And with the remainder of the loan, she will use it to buy stock of merchandise for constant future sales. For her prospect, Chhem wishes to have a bigger store with many types of merchandise to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland

loans.name: Kring

texts.en:
Kring, age 42, has spent most her lifetime involved in rice farming along with her husband. They live and work in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. They have been blessed with three children, two of whom are working at a garment factory in Phnom Penh, while the youngest child is studying in the province.

Kring would like to acquire a loan from HKL in order to purchase a piece of land to improve the business, thereby producing a stronger income from it. Kring’s dream is to provide for a higher education for her third child, preferably resulting in a university degree - a goal she is willing to work as hard as necessary to attain.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
Yesica, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Jegner quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho. Juntos habitan su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Yesica es la venta de productos de belleza como cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, entre otros. Todos estos productos son comprados por catálogo y vendidos desde su casa a sus familiares, amistades y vecinos, muchas veces a créditos. Brindándoles una atención amable y cordial, de esa manera se gana su preferencia y  la recomiendan con otras personas, que con el tiempo se vuelven sus clientes habituales. Tiene más de 5 años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.
Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos, el poder tener un oficio y sentirse una persona productiva, además de dejarle tiempo libre para cuidar de sus hijos. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por tanto, tiene planes de seguir en su negocio y ampliarlo comprando más mercadería para tener stock disponible para la venta. Este será  el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además de comenta sentirse a gusto con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues los considera un grupo responsable y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como perfumes, cosméticos, cremas entre otros, para tener un stock disponible para la venta, buscando precios de campaña y/o más bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Yesica, age 37, is a hard-working and diligent woman.  In addition to being cheerful and friendly, she has a great desire to get ahead.  She lives with Jegner, and he works in transportation.  He is the father of their two children, ages 12 and 8.  She loves them very much.  They live together in their own house.

Yesica sells beauty products like cosmetics, perfumes, and creams, among others.  All of these products are purchased by catalog.  They are sold from her house to her relatives, friends, and neighbors.  Many times she sells on credit.  She waits on her customers with a kind and cordial manner.  This way she wins them over, and they recommend her to other people.  In time they become her regular customers.

She has been devoting herself to this business for over five years, and so far she works alone.  She likes her business because of the income, being able to have an occupation and feeling like a productive person, and because it leaves her free time to take care of her children.  

She considers her business to be quite profitable because of the good income it gives her.  Therefore, she has plans to continue in her business.  She plans to expand it by purchasing more merchandise to have in stock that is available for sale.

This will be her sixth loan with MFP.  She hopes for a small loan in order to be able to meet her objectives.  She also says that she feels good about the communal bank’s work.  She considers it to be a responsible and supportive group.

She will use the requested 1,200 soles to buy merchandise like perfumes, cosmetic, and creams, among others.  She will do this in order to have stock ready to sell.  She is looking for seasonal prices and or lower prices for buying in volume.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris de 51 años de edad, es una mujer, carismática, luchadora con ganas de superación. Es c asada con Tito, quien es obrero de construcción, y padre de sus 2 queridos hijos, de 19 y 16 años de edad, por quienes se esfuerza por darles lo mejor y ver que no les falte nada. Vive en su casa propia lo cual construyo con la ayuda de su querido esposo. El trabajo que realiza Doris es costura, cose ropas de diferentes variedades para todo tipo de ocasión, lo cual lo realiza en su casa propia en un ambiente que acondicionó especialmente para la eximición de sus trabajos terminados. 
Se inició con esta actividad gracias a que estudió en un centro de educación ocupacional, invirtió su propio capital para pagar su matrícula, ella sabía que la inversión le  daría muchas  satisfacciones, aprendió e invirtió su capital comprando máquinas de costura y materiales  para empezar con esa actividad.
Esta actividad la viene realizando hace más de 5 años, tiempo que le  sirvió para hacerse conocida por la calidad de su costura, y así cada día aumenta el número de clientes quienes la recomiendan con otras personas. 
Considera rentable a esta actividad ya que puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar y darles mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
Nos comenta que antes de empezar con esta actividad tenía muchos problemas económicos, espera seguir creciendo y ampliar más su negocio y convertirse en una empresaria de costura. Este sería el préstamo número 04 con la MFP, está muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, ya que así avanzara con su negocio y se convertirá en una gran empresaria. Por otro lado nos comenta que está muy contenta por ser parte de un grupo responsable.
Con el préstamo solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, blondas entre otras. Para tener un stock disponible de materiales, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera aumentar su margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Doris, 51, is an energetic woman with a strong drive to get ahead in the world.  She and her husband, Tito, a construction worker, have 2 children, 19- and 16-years old, respectively.  They live in a house that she and Tito built.  Doris operates a sewing business.  She makes all kinds of clothing, working from a space in her house that was designed to be her workshop.  
Doris started the business after taking a course at a local vocational school.  She used her own money to start the business and says that she knew that she would enjoy being a business owner.  She bought sewing machines, fabrics, etc. to get started.  That was 5 years ago and she says that the business is going well.  She's known for the quality of her work.  Her customers recommend her to their friends and her list of customers is growing by the day.  She considers the business a success because she can help her husband with household expenses and pay for things her children need, too.
Doris tells us that she had a lot of economic problems before she started the business.  She wants to grow the business and make it a proper clothing factory.  
This will be Doris' 4th MFP loan and she is grateful to the bank for helping her grow her business. She tells us that she likes her community bank because she likes being part of a responsible group.
Doris will use this 1000 new soles loan to buy wholesale supplies of fabrics, threads, lace, etc., so that can continue growing her sewing business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing business.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 44-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and the mother of three children.

Abeer is making pastries and food. She is working from her home and requesting a loan of to purchase materials needed in baking pastries. Abeer is looking to establish a restaurant for her business so that she can enlarge her customer base and thus increase the family income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to bake pastries

loans.name: Nom

texts.en:
Nom, 42, is an industrious mother who has been living in Pouk district, where agricultural businesses are very common for the local people. Nom is a rice farmer who also takes some time to make red sugar from sugar palm juice that her husband brings from the palm trees around his village. Nom now has been blessed with four single children attending a local school.

In order to stabilize her present business, Nom would like to acquire some funds from HKL to buy a large bowl pane and prepare a suitable place where she can make her sugar. For her future goal, she intends to expand her existing businesses and save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a large bowl pane and prepare a suitable place where she can make her sugar

loans.name: Asi Mas

texts.en:
Asi Mas sells fish that her husband catches. Her husband, Mosa, is a fisherman. When it is not fishing season, Asi Mas supplements with her new business selling perfume, beauty goods, and small electric and electronic items such as flashlights. She buys the items from Phnom Penh market and carries them by her motorbike to resell in her village. 

Asi Mas wants to expand her business by purchasing more perfume, beauty goods, and small electric and electronic items for sale, so she is asking for a loan of $1,300 to help her capital. She will also use a part of the loan to assist in her mother’s grocery inventory by buying more grocery items for resale. 

Asi Mas and her husband have been married since 1986 and they have one son and four daughters. Three attend school and the other two are still young. Asi Mas’s family is Cham Muslim. The Cham are an ethnic minority in Cambodia. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy perfume, beauty goods, and small electric and electronic items for resale

loans.name: Sery

texts.en:
Srey, age 34, earns an income from raising pigs. She lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, where the common businesses of the local people are farming, pig-raising, livestock husbandry, fishing, and selling firewood. Srey's husband sells firewood to earn a second income for the family. Together, they typically earn around 5.00 USD per day. They have been blessed with three children.

Srey would like to acquire a loan to purchase a stock of firewood for her husband to offer for sale. She hopes that she will be able to further develop the business and improve her family's living conditions through this loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of firewood to offer for sale

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar, de 22 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además es alegre y muy amable. Es conviviente con Harold quien es mecánico y padre de su hija de 2 años de edad q es su mayor motivación. Juntos habitan la casa de sus suegros e compañía de su cuñada. La actividad que realza Pilar es el servicio de mecánica de motos para esto cuenta con un taller que abrió en sociedad con su pareja en su propia casa. Donde brindan un buen  servicio a sus clientes quienes vuelven en posteriores oportunidades y los recomiendan con otras personas que con el tiempo se vuelven en sus clientes habituales. Tienen más de 1 año dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja brindando un buen servicio.
Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos, el estar en casa y cuidar de sus hijos y trabajar a lado de su pareja, deseando convertirse en una prospera empresaria. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene y las buenas ganancias  que le deja.  Por eso tiene planes de ampliar y añadir un tienda de venta de repuestos de motos, así incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de una vitrina y repuestos de motos, para dar comienzo a su nuevo negocio, así brindar un servicio completo, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Pilar, 22, is a hardworking woman, who is friendly and happy.  She lives with Harold, who is a mechanic and the father of their two-year-old daughter.  They live together with Harold's parents and his sister.  Pilar is a motorcycle mechanic in the workshop she and her husband opened in their house.  They are known for their good service, so their clients return to them and recommend them to other people; over time, they have developed a pool of regular customers.  She has been working in this business for more than a year, and has been able to count on her partner's support to offer a good service.

She likes her work because of the money it brings in, the fact that she can be at home and take of her children, and because she can work alongside her partner.  She wants to turn herself into a prosperous businesswoman.  It is a rather good business because there is lots of demand, and it brings in a good income.  Therefore, she wants to expand it and add a store to sell motorcycle parts so as to increase her earnings.

This is her third loan with Kiva partner MFP.  She needs this small loan to reach her goals. She also reports that she is happy with her community bank because the members are responsible and comradely people.

She will invest the $750 in buying a storefront window and motorcycle parts to get her new business started.  Thus, she will be able to offer a complete service and to find the lowest prices for things by buying in bulk.

loans.use: to buy a storefront window and motorcycle parts.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hamzah

texts.en: Hamzah, 31 years old, is a married guy. Hamzah originally worked as a salesman for a food company. A year ago, he started a new small business to do besides his regular  job. He is selling birds and fish in his own store. Today, Hamzah has applied for a loan to buy new kinds of birds for the store that have been requested by bird lovers.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of birds for the store

loans.name: Sokh

texts.en:
Sokh is 39 years old and is a married woman who has been living in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She has a life partner with her husband and is blessed with four single children. 

Sokh has been operating a pig-raising business, followed by a rice business, earning approximately $1.50 USD per day. Her husband manages a business of selling firewood with one of her children, going through the nearby commune and markets of the province. At the present, this business has run out of its stock. Because of this, Sokh’s family is experiencing financial difficulties. Therefore, Sokh is looking for finances from HKL to purchase stock of the firewood to sustain her family-owned business. This is her third cycle loan with HKL as well as a first one with Kiva. Sokh is an honest client of our firm. As experienced, she has never made any late payments.

loans.use: to purchase stock of firewood to sustain her family-owned business

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny (pictured here) is 33 years old and her husband, Soy, is 42 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 15 kilometres away. They have been married since 1995 and have four children - three sons and one daughter. One is a garment worker, two attend school, and another one is still too young. 

Ny has been operating a business, renting out a space of her house to garment workers for five years. Her husband is a garment worker. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 42 years old and lives in Nakuru town. He is married to Rodha, and they have three children. He has been in the transportation business  for the last 15 years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy new tires for his vehicle and also service it so that it can be in a good condition.

In the future, Henry hopes to expand his business by buying a school bus for hire. By investing more in the transportation industry, Henry hopes to become one of the leading businessmen in Nakuru.

loans.use: To service his vehicle and buy new tires

loans.name: Koul

texts.en:
Koul is 31 years old. She is now a widow with only an 18-year-old son who assists her in managing the field of crops. She grows crops like rice, potatoes, and vegetables. Typically, she is able to generate an income of 2.50 USD per day. To provide a better income for their family, Koul's lovely son, Ya, is involved in construction work around the province.

Koul is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy cashew nuts in bulk from the local farmers. She will resell the nuts at a higher price in the future. Koul said that this loan will help her family to increase its income.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk for future sale.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 29 years old and married to Hassan. They have three school-going children. She has operated her business selling clothes in Nakuru town for the last four years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her neighbors, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes to sell in her business.

In the future, Damaris hopes to grow her business and sell new imported clothes. This will enable her to earn more income and be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia has practiced farming in Nyahururu town for the last three years. She is 38 years of age, married to Simon, and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She plans to use this loan amount to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her crops on her farm, as well as part of it will be used for labour purposes.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to venture in large-scale farming, thereby get more and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 43 years old from Naivasha and is married to Paul. They have two children who are in school.

Mary has a call center business known as M-PESA and also sells polythene bags. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy polythene bags. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a fellow client.

She hopes to excel in her business and open a shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy polythene bags

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Reem is a 40-year-old woman. She is a mother with three sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's costs and needs.

Reem needs to purchase a new refrigerator and a washing machine, so she is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing these two home appliances. This will improve Reem's family's home living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and a washing machine

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon is from Dongkor commune, Phnom Penh city. He is married with two school-aged children who are depending on his income. He works for a garment factory as a mechanical fixer and he usually gets a fixed salary monthly. Chhuon also has his wife who helps him to earn the household income to better their living. 

Chhuon is now seeking for a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to repair some parts of his present house. He wants his family to live in a comfortable and suitable shelter. For his prospect, Chhuon intends buy a piece of land for growing crops and vegetables. Furthermore, he wants to build a cage for raising poultry like chickens and ducks.

loans.use: to repair some parts of his present house

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is 36 years old and married to Winfred, who contributes to the family income. 

He has been running his bakery for a period of about three years with a monthly income of about 25,000 Kenya shillings. 

He is taking his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. He wants to use the loan to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil for selling. He hopes to have a big bakery and be a leading supplier.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Elda

texts.es:
Elda, de 39 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de superación, es separada, es madre de 3 hijos a los cuales quiere mucho y son su inspiración para salir adelante, desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Vive en su casa propia la cual construyo con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza  Elda es la venta de comida y frutas. En las mañanas labora  como ayudante en un restaurant que es de propiedad de su amiga lo cual le genera un ingreso económico. En las tardes se dedica a la venta de frutas en el mercado bellavista, está  actividad lo empezó a realizar  comprando en pocas cantidades de frutas  con su propio capital, y viendo la buena acogida que tuvo su negocio se decidió continuar y hasta el momento se dedica  sola.  
Lo considera rentable porque tiene mucha demanda y le da un buen ingreso económico, y así puede brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Antes de tener esta actividad sus ingresos económicos eran muy pocos y no le alcanzaban para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar, ya que se había separado del padre de sus hijos. Teniendo esta dificultad se decidió a empezar este negocio.
Viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar y aumentar su negocio ya que se hizo conocido por la zona y espera comprar variedades de  frutas, así poder tener más acogida, así  verá crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que podrá tener acceso a una línea de crédito para continuar con su negocio, por tanto se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, nos comenta que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal pues los considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá  comprando  variedades de frutas, para surtir su negocio y ofrecer mayor  variedad a sus clientes, espera  conseguir precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera obtendrá mayores ganancias
texts.en:
Elda is 39, and an enterprising woman who is eager to improve herself. She is separated, and the mother of three children whom she loves very much, and who inspire her to keep going. She wishes to offer them a better quality of life. She lives in her own home, which she built with a great deal of effort.

Elda sells meals and fruit. In the mornings she works as a helper in a restaurant that belongs to a friend, and earns income from this. In the afternoons she sells fruit in Bellavista market. She started doing this work by buying fruit in small quantities with her own working capital. 

On seeing the good reception her business had, she decided to continue, working on her own up to now. She considers the business to be profitable because she has a lot of demand and it gives her a good income. This way she is able to give her children the best. 

Before she had this business, her income was very little, and not sufficient to cover all her household expenses, as she had separated from her children's father. Because she had this difficult situation, she decided to start her business. Seeing the good outcome, she has plans to continue and expand her business, since it has become well-known in the area. She hopes to buy a variety of fruit, and so have more customers and see her business grow. 

This will be her fifth loan with the MFP institution. She is happy to know she will have access to a line of credit to continue with her business, so she promises tp make her installment payments on time. She tells us that she likes working with her communal bank as she considers it a close-knit and supportive group. She will use the requested amount of 1,000 nuevos soles to buy different types of fruit to supply her business and offer more variety to her customers. She hopes to secure low prices through volume purchases, and earn greater profits this way.

loans.use: To buy fruit at wholesale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora, de 61 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora que se ha esforzado en salir adelante, además es alegre y amable. Es separada del padre de sus hijos. Vive en su propia casa en compañía de su nieta de 14 años de edad. La actividad que realiza Dora es la venta de golosinas y bebidas gaseosas de diversos sabores y marcas. Todos estos productos los vende en el frontis de su casa donde instala una pequeña mesa y exhibe sus golosinas y bebidas. Atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. Tiene más de 12 años dedicándose a éste negocio, tiempo que le valió para hacerse muy conocida en la zona, donde atiene ella sola. Le gusta su negocio  por los ingresos económicos, el contar con un oficio y sentirse una persona productiva, además de cubrir sus necesidades personales. Considera a su negocio rentable por las ganancias que le deja y le sirve para mantenerse. Por eso, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio ya que lo conoce muy bien. Este será el préstamo número 13 con la institución MFP. . Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues los considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles los invertirá en compra de mercaderías para su negocio como son sus golosinas y bebidas gaseosas para tener un stock disponible para la venta, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Dora, 61 years old, is a hard-working woman who, in addition to being happy and likable, has helped herself to get ahead. She is separated from the father of her children. She lives in her own home with her fourteen year-old granddaughter. Dora sells various flavors and brands of sweets and soda pop. She sells these products from the front of her house, where she has a small table set up to display her sweets and soda pop. She serves her customers, the majority of whom are her neighbors, in a friendly and likable manner. She has spent more than twelve years working this way, which has helped to make her well-known in her neighborhood. She likes her business because of the economic return it provides her, the benefit of having a trade, and the feeling it gives her of being a productive person, in addition to providing for her personal needs. She considers her business to be profitable due to the revenue it provides her, which helps it to stay solvent. As a result, she has plans to continue with her business, which she already knows well. This will be her thirteenth loan with MFP [Microfinanzas Prisma]. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, since she is sure that she will move forward with her business. She also feels comfortable with her communal bank, since she believes everyone to be united and supportive.
She will invest the 2000 PEN [$750] requested by purchasing merchandise for her business, allowing her to have stock available, and to look for lower prices for volume purchases.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and soda pop.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es separada del padre de su hija. Vive en su propia casa en compañía de su hija de 16 años de edad, a quien quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Ana es la venta de productos de belleza que compra por catálogo, y los vende desde su casa entre sus amistades, vecinas y familiares. Además se dedica a la venta de parrilladas de pollos los fines de semana en el  frontis de su casa.  Tiene más de 15 años dedicándose a éste negocio, contando con el apoyo de su hija buscando nuevos clientes. Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos, el disponer de su propio horario de trabajo, y estar en la comodidad de su hogar. Por lo contrario, no le gusta cuando algunos de algunos de sus clientes se atrasan con el pago de sus créditos.  Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja. Por tanto, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio, y en un futuro abrir u restaurante en su propia casa, brindando mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que vienen dando a las personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como productos de belleza para tener un stock disponible para la venta, buscando menos precios por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
39-year-old Ana is hardworking and determined, as well as being a very kind and friendly lady. She would very much like to improve her position in life. She lives in her own home together with her 16-year-old daughter, whom she loves very much. Ana is separated from her daughter’s father. Ana is in the retail business; she buys beauty products from catalogues and sells them from home. Her customers are friends, neighbours and relatives. At weekends she also sells barbecued chicken in front of her house. She has worked in this business for over 15 years and her daughter helps her to find new clients. 

Ana is pleased with her business because it provides her with an income and allows her to set her own hours and work from the comfort of her own home. On the other hand, she doesn’t like it when a few of her customers are slow to settle their bills. She considers her business fairly profitable due to the amount she earns. That is why she plans to continue in this line of work and open a restaurant in her house in future, in order to provide her customers with a more comfortable experience. 

This will be Ana’s 10th loan from MFP and she hopes that she will be granted this small loan so that she can meet her objectives. She says she is pleased with her community bank because of the support they offer to people. She plans to use the 1500 PEN loan to invest in merchandise such as beauty products, in order to have enough stock to sell. She would like to get the products for a lower price by buying them in bulk.
