She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper, bitter boil, and okra for her business, and plans to enable her children to continue in school and build a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, bitter boil, and okra for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 28 years old and lives in Airport.  She is a high school graduate, single, and has a 7-year-old child who lives at home and goes to school. For the past three years, she been selling rubber dishes and slippers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and rubber dishes for her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila de 30 años hace 10 años convive con Ronald, el padre de sus 2 hijas: Leticia de 9 y Yadira de 5 años de edad. Toda esta familia vive en una casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado San Juan Centro Autiki, distrito de Pichanaki, Chanchamayo. Lucila es una mujer organizada. Su hogar y familia reflejan su sobresaliente valor. Cuenta con un negocio en su propia casa, “tengo una tienda de abarrotes, ahí vendo de todo, hace 1 año”, menciona, añadiendo que le va muy bien. 
Además se dedica a la agricultura. Posee 3 parcelas de terrenos donde produce plátano y un poco de café.  Obteniendo de 15 a 20 sacos de café seco. Es consiente que este trabajo es cansado y absorbente, por eso Ronald se encuentra en el campo mayormente y Rosa tiene que cerrar su negocio para atender sus cultivos.
Lucila distribuye bien su tiempo, para sus hijos, su hogar, su negocio y sus cultivos. Gracias a ese esfuerzo puede estar segura que sus ingresos económicos solventarán sus necesidades básicas.
Le gusta realizar estas actividades por eso continuará con sus labores agrícolas. Ahora piensa ampliar más sus sembríos de café, por ello deberá invertir en plantas y abonos. Éste sería su crédito número 8 que obtendría de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Flor de San Juan” es el nombre de su banco comunal. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a un grupo sólido y participativo. Con el dinero podrá abastecer la mercadería para su negocio, también podrá pagar a los jornaleros que contratará para hacer la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
30-year-old Lucila has been living with her partner Ronald for 10 years.  He is the father of her two children: 9-year-old Leticia and 5-year-old Yadira.  The family live together in their own home in San Juan Centro Autiki, in Pichanaki district, in Chachamayo province.  Lucila is an organized woman.  Her house and her family reflect this outstanding virtue.  She has a business in her own home.  "I have a grocery store where I sell a bit of everything.  I have had it for one year", she comments, adding that it is doing very well.

Lucila is also a farmer.  She has three plots of land where she grows bananas and a little coffee.  She obtains 15 to 20 sacks of coffee beans.  She is aware that this work is tiring and time-consuming.  For this reason, Ronald works mainly in the fields and Rosa has to close her business to attend to her crops.  Lucila divides her time carefully between her children, her household, her business and her crops.  Thanks to her efforts, she is able to ensure that her income covers her basic needs.  She enjoys her work and, for that reason, she will continue carrying out her agricultural work.  Lucila is now planning to further expand her coffee plantings and will need to invest in plants and fertilizers.

This will be Lucila's eighth loan from MFP and she gives her word that she will be punctual in making her repayments.  'Flor de San Juan' is the name of her community bank.  She feels happy to belong to such a solid and active group.  She will use her money to stock up with merchandise for her business.  She will also be able to pay the laborers who she will hire to weed her crops.

loans.use: to hire laborers and buy products to stock her business

loans.name: Nesfat

texts.en:
Nesfat is a 60-year-old hardworking man. He has two daughters and a son.

Nesfat opened a clothes shop two years ago in an active area. During these two years he has been able to add more and more goods to the store. 

Now he has applied for a loan to update his inventory with new fashionable clothes that go with the fashion these days.

loans.use: to buy new fashionable clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a 48-year-old married woman. Her husband works in making blocks for building. She has two married sons and three other single children.

Yusra buys and sells blankets and clothes to help her husband in supporting the family and covering their monthly expenses. 

She has applied for a loan to increase her inventory and thus to increase her income.

loans.use: to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three daughters and a son. 

Hanan works in a youth center, and her husband works for the government..

Besides her job, Hanan owns a number of sheep that she raises and takes care of to sell. Now Hanan has applied for a loan to buy food for the sheep and to buy more sheep.

loans.use: to buy food for the sheep and to buy more sheep.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline, who lives in Air Port, is 33 years old, married, and the mother of  three children between the ages of  2 and 11, the two oldest in school. For five years Roseline has been selling rubbers dishes, and she is now requesting a loan to purchase  more. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 28 years old and lives in Airport.  She is single and has three children between the ages of 3 months and 12 years. Two of her children are in school and live at home. 

She has been selling rubber dishes for three years now.  She started her business at the time she was working as a cook. She used six months of her salary for her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase rubber dishes for her business.  Her plans are to send her children to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie lives in Airport.  She is 28 years old, single, and has two children, ages 5 and 7. They are in school and live at home.

For the past four years, Winnie has been selling rice, oil, pepper, onions, and bitter ball. One problem she is facing is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, bitter ball, pepper, and onions for her business. Her future plans are to send her children to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, bitter ball, pepper, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Floviance

texts.en: Floviance, a 26-year-old married mother of one, sells used sweaters, blouses and trousers to earn a living. In business for two years, she employs one person. Since joining Faulu Kenya, Floviance has been able to save her income, and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She is now requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more used sweaters, blouses and trousers to sell.

loans.use: to buy used sweaters, blouses and trousers to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a businessman. He sells milk to earn a living. He has been in this business for one year. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, David has been able to save his income. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy milk to sell.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 31 years old and married with three children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for 10 years. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Peter has been able to expand his business. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 80,000 KES to buy sugar, cooking oil and sodas to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 35 años es una madre soltera de 2 hijos de 18 y 12 años. Ella vive contenta con sus 2 hijos en una casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado San Juan Centro Autiki, distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Los campos de cultivo de su localidad son propicios para la siembra de diversos frutos, por eso Rosa se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra café y plátanos en sus 4 parcelas de tierras fértiles.
“Tengo 4 lotes, 3 que producen entre café y plátanos; y otra parcela, ahí recién sembré café”, menciona. Rosa tendrá que esperar 3 años como mínimo para ver brotar los primeros granos del café.
Ella no se siente sola. Sus hijos la apoyan en todo momento en el trabajo duro. Pero la temporada de cosecha requiere más esfuerzo, por eso contrata a jornaleros para agilizar esta labor. 
Hace 5 años, tenía ciertos inconvenientes, que en su mayoría era la falta de capital. Ahora puede contar con apoyo económico de MFP. Menciona sentirse respaldada. De esa manera continuará con su trabajo, ahorrando e invirtiendo en la agricultura. Rosa accedería a su crédito número 8 de MFP, gracias a su ayuda. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Flor de San Juan” es el nombre de su banco comunal. Se siente cómoda te tener como compañeros a personas solidarias. Rosa invertiría los 600 soles que solicita en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus 3 parcelas de cultivos que se encuentran cubiertos de malezas. Ella paga 30 soles al día.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 35, is the single mother of two children, ages 18 and 12.  She lives contentedly with her two children in her own house in the town of San Juan Centro Autiki in the Pichanaki district, Chanchamayo province.

The farmland in her area is favorable for growing different fruits.  Therefore, Rosa dedicates herself to farming.  She grows coffee and bananas on her four parcels of fertile land.  “I have four lots; three of them produce café and or bananas.  On the other lot I have recently planted coffee,” she says.  Rosa will have to wait three years minimum to see the first coffee beans sprout.

She does not feel alone.  Her children support her at every moment with the hard work.  However, during the harvesting season she needs extra effort.  She hires day workers to expedite the work.

Five years ago she had certain obstacles, which was mostly the lack of capital.  Now she is able to count on financial support with MFP.  She says that she feels supported.  This is the way she will continue with her work, saving and investing in farming.

This will be Rosa’s eighth loan with MFP, thanks to your help.  She pledges to be punctual with her monthly payments.  

Flor de San Juan is the name of her communal bank.  She feels comfortable to have supportive people as her colleagues.  Rosa will use the requested 600 soles to pay day workers.  She will hire them to clear the weeds from three parcels of crops that are coverd with weeds.  She pays 30 soles per day.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 43 years old, is a married man who has five sons and daughters.

Mohammad has his own fruit and vegetable stall that he wants to improve and expand. He has applied for a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables. He also want to start another business selling electronics.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Joseph Mwangi

texts.en:
Joseph has managed a retail shop for the past nine years. He has applied for his forth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy flour, sugar and cooking fat in bulk for sale.

He hopes to boost his business and get a good harvest in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and cooking fat in bulk.

loans.name: Gereshon

texts.en:
Gereshon, age 36, has a polythene bag sales business. He has been engaged in this business for the past nine months. He and his wife have three children, all of whom are enrolled in school.

Gereshon has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd, which will enable him add stock of bags to offer for sale. He was introduced to KADET by one of our staff.

He hopes to see his business grow to great heights in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of bags to offer for sale

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is a 57-year-old married man. He has eight children between the ages of 8 and 28 years. He lives in Hudaidah,Yemen. He describes himself as competent and ambitious. He operates a retail business, providing and selling spare parts. He has been involved in this business for 13 years thus has enough experience to attract loyal customers & to expand his business. His business is located in an area conducive to his service; his primary customers are mechanics. His biggest business challenge is the high price of spare parts. He works hard to improve his business in order to provide his family with good and healthy living conditions.

Nasser applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy more spare parts for his business. Nasser`s business dream and goal is to run big mechanic workshop in addition to his recent business.

loans.use: buy more spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 26-year-old married man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a mill ("tahoun") and has been involved in purchasing grains then selling them to his customers after milling. He started his business because it has fast sales in the market and is attractive to business partners. He works at the business from 7:00 am until 7:30 pm, 7 days per week. He is an incredibly hard-working man and as a result has a lot of experience. In addition, it is the only main source of his income. On the other hand, through lots of effort, he has managed to grind his customer`s grain, i.e., he provides them a service to put food on the table. Recently, he says that the main challenge to his business is a seasonal problem: during the dry season this type of product is very expensive.

So, Mohammed took out a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grain for his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. 

In the future, he would like to expand his business to have a extra mill store because his region is lacking some services which he could supply to solve people's needs.

loans.use: to purchase grain for his milling business so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is a 42-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan.

Kefah has a home-based project. She started her business through selling clothes door-to-door then she started making handmade embroidery.

Kefah is requesting a loan of 500 JD to enlarge her project by purchasing raw materials needed. She is looking to establish a small workshop for making embroidery.

loans.use: to enlarge her project by purchasing raw materials needed

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 45-year-old businessman who is married to Beth, a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been working a crafts business for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a staff member. Martin will use the loan to buy crafts for sale. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, Martin will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: to buy crafts for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has operated her beauty salon in Nakuru for the last nine years. She is 38 years old and married to Job. They have been blessed with three children.

Rose was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy another hair dryer for use in her business. This will also enable her to serve and sustain her customers well.

In the future, Rose hopes to grow her business and own another beauty salon in Nakuru. This will enable her to make more money and buy a plot of land on which to construct a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy another hair dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward, age 49, practices mixed crop farming. He and his wife Elizabeth, also a farmer, are blessed with three children. He has been in a farming business for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.
 
He is applying for his third loan after repaying the previous loans successfully. Edward will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will ensure the education of his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Khaleel

texts.en:
Khaleel is a 35-year-old married man from Hay Nazal, Amman, Jordan and a father of one child.

Khaleel has a kids' toys and clothes shop and he is requesting a loan of 2000 JD to purchase more kids' toys and clothes for business purposes.

Khaleel is looking to open another branch for his shop and purchase new furniture for his house with an aspiration of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase kids' toys and clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a conservative person thus she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband, Ghaleb.

Manal is a 37-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Manal sells birds and she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more birds so that she can expand her customer base and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase birds for business purposes

loans.name: Manwah

texts.en:
Manwah is a 59-year-old divorced woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Manwah has a beauty salon and she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to purchase a comfortable chair for her salon and some other equipment.

Manwah is looking to improve her family's living conditions in addition to paying the remaining installments for her house

loans.use: to purchase a comfortable chair for her salon and some other equipment

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 37 years old, a married man who has six children and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has six years of experience in tailoring then selling men's clothing. He is able to choose appropriate merchandise because he has good taste. 

He chose this business because it is very profitable and he has gained permanent clients over the years. He is friendly, polite and always gives a discount. He lives in a rented house which is expensive. He says the secret of his success is his shop's location, in the central bazaar. 

Ahmed`s monthly income is not enough to cover his family's needs so he has applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase men's fabrics in order to stitch trousers and shirts. He will use this loan to purchase new merchandise and diversify. 

In the future, Ahmed would like to open branches of tailoring shops in all provinces of his country as well as have a house of his own.

loans.use: to purchase men's fabrics in order to stitch trousers and shirts for his business.

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is in his mid-40s and married with three children, two of whom go to school. Since 2006, he has been selling sand and stone and running a quarry. Mohamed works from seven in the morning through five in the afternoon daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. He will share his loan with his loan group, "Uwezesho," which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Mohamed is requesting his ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use his loan to buy one lorry of sand and stone to sell. Mohamed used his previous loans to buy land and pay household expenses. He has successfully repaid his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy sand and stone to sell

loans.name: Pathé

texts.fr:
Monsieur Pathé est un jeune commerçant qui a ouvert une boutique d’alimentation générale dans son quartier.  Il a une expérience de 8 ans dans ce domaine. Pathé est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. C’est un habitué du guichet car il a déjà eu à bénéficier de 3 crédits pour renforcer son activité. Etant dans une zone très fréquentée, il a l’opportunité de fructifier son commerce car il y a une forte demande.  
Avec le crédit, il va acheter les denrées les plus rapides à écouler comme le sucre, le lait, le thé, le savon... 
Malgré son jeune âge, Pathé s’est très tôt responsabilisé dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. C’est lui qui se charge de la nourriture ; il s’occupe aussi des frais de scolarité de ses enfants, mais réussi tout de même à mettre de l’argent de coté. Dans l’avenir il voudrait agrandir sa boutique avec l’appui des preteurs.
texts.en:
Mr. Pathé is a young merchant who opened a general food store in his neighborhood. He has eight years of experience in this field. He's 35 years old, married, and the father of two children.

He's a regular at the MFI's local branch, since he already benefited from three loans to strengthen his business. Being located in a busy area, he is able to bolster his business since the demand is high.

With this loan, he will buy food products that sell the fastest, such as sugar, milk, tea, soap, etc. Early on, in spite of his young age, Pathé became responsible for handling the daily expenses.

He's in charge for the food, and also covers his children's school expenses. He nevertheless manages to put money away. In the future, he would like to expand his store with the support of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, tea, cooking oil, soap, etc.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga de 50 años está casada con Fortunato, el padre de sus 6 hijos, pero sólo vive con 4 de ellos, cuyas edades oscilan entre los 19 y 9 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en el centro poblado San Juan Centro Autiki, distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Desde niña, Olga se dedica a la agricultura. Ella nació rodeada de cultivos que sus padres producían. Así aprendió sobre esta actividad. Ahora que es una madre y mujer casada tiene 10 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas, pero solo produce en 4.  “Siembro 3 lotes de café para el negocio, los plátanos y yucas solo es para el consumo de mi familia”, dice. La venta de café abastece para mantener a su hogar. Cada cosecha obtiene 20 sacos de café, los que vende a buen precio en la ciudad de Pichanaki. Los compradores frecuentan el mercado mayorista en los meses de mayo a julio (meses de cosechas).
Por su parte, Fortunato, trabaja como operario o jornalero en otros cultivos. Y cuando ella termina de hacer sus tareas del hogar, se dirige hacia sus cultivos para apoyar a su esposo. El trabajo es coordinado por eso sus ganancias son la mejor retribución para su esfuerzo. Éste sería su crédito número 8 que obtendría de MFP, por eso da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse satisfecho con su banco comunal “Flor de San Juan”, por el trabajo en equipo. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de machetes nuevos y en el pago a los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Olga, age 50, is married to Fortunato, the father of their six children.  They only live with four of the children, whose ages range from 19-9.  This family lives in their own house in the town of San Juan Centro Autiki in the Pichanaki district, Chanchamayo province.

Olga has devoted herself to agriculture since she was a young girl.  Now that she is a mother and married, she has ten parcels of farmland.  She only produces on four of them.  “I plant three lots of coffee for the business.  The bananas and yuccas are only for my family’s consumption,” she says.

The sale of coffee provides support for her household.  Each harvest produces 20 sacks of coffee that she sells for a good price in the city of Pichanaki.  The buyers frequent the wholesale market in the months of May through July (harvest months).

In turn, Fortunato works as an operator or day worker on other crops.  When she finishes her housework, she heads towards her crops to support her husband.  The work is coordinated, and the earnings are the best reward for her effort.

This will be her eighth loan with MFP.  She gives her word to punctually make her monthly payments.  She affirms that she is happy with her communal bank, Flor de San Juan, for the teamwork.

She will use the loan to buy new machetes and to pay the day workers who will clear the weeds from her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy machetes and to hire day workers.

loans.name: Fawziah Group

texts.en:
FAWZIAH Group is made up of four people, Fawziah, Sumiah, Wafa and Haifa, who live in the same neighborhood in Sana`a, Yemen. They requested a loan of 120,000  YER as financial support  with the aim of increasing their business.

Fawziah is 38 years old, a married woman with four children, all of them in school. She lives with her husband and children in Sana`a. She has been operating an incense sales business for two years. (She is the second woman from the right,  holding a box of  incense in her hand).

This business allows her to meet her family's needs without much difficulty. She obtains her supplies at a market in the city. She says the main challenges faced are high school fees for her children. 

In the hope of better responding to customer demand, she would like to build up her product stock and enhance her business activity. In order to do so, Fawziah requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy more incense for resale. 

The extra income generated as a result of this loan will help in easing payment of school fees. In the future, Fawziah plans to develop her business into a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more incense for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 37-year-old business lady. She is married to John, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 18,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Jane will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 35-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of two children. She has been running a boutique shop for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Regina will use the loan to buy a stock of new clothes for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a big boutique shop, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
This is Chun, a humble villager who resides in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is a widow and a mother who is responsible for two children. Both of her children are married. Chun earns her livelihood by as a rice farmer. She has been a rice farmer for over 30 years, and has provided her family with a suitable income. 

Chun is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner HKL to purchase a stock of rice from local villagers. This will improve her living standard and provide enough food for her entire family through the year. Chun has already received four previous loans from her MFI but this is her first loan with a Kiva partner. Chun is an honest client who always pays her loans back on time and follows her schedule.

loans.use: to purchase rice from local villagers

loans.name: Mt Uluguru Group

texts.en:
Seven is single and in his mid-20s. For the past three years, he has been running two businesses: a motorcycle transport business and a vegetable stall. Seven works daily from seven in the morning through six thirty at night and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

Seven is requesting his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, to start building his own house.  His dream is to one day be able to finish building his house. Seven will share this loan with his loan group, "Mt Uluguru," which has 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to start building his own house

loans.name: Bula Group

texts.en:
The borrower, who is in her early 60's, is married with four children, three of them are grown up and one is at the university. She has had a poultry business for 10 years now. She works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying more chicks. Her dream is to one day be able to build herself another house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "bula" which has a total of 22 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
Lem is 43 years old, living in Batey district of Kompong Cham province. She has a common law relationship with her spouse for over 20 years and has been blessed with five children; four are single and one is married. Lem has devoted her life time dedicated to rice husbandry, the only business she can generate her livelihood from. Her spouse is also in the same type of business. They work very hard to provide their children a good education, so they may have good jobs in the future.

For this time with her first cycle loan with HKL and Kiva, Lem will use the loan to buy fertilizers to put in her soil to keep her crops in good condition and thereby increase the output of rice. Lem wishes to expand this business in the following years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to put in her soil.

loans.name: Achieng

texts.en:
Achieng lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 39 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Achieng heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Bor. She sells food at a stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 26 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase wheat flour and sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 40-year-old businessman. He is married to Sarah, a business lady. They are blessed with two children. He has been working with a handcraft  for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 9,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by KADET staff. Peter will use the loan to buy handcrafts designed to carry fruits to sell to his customers. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a taxi car.

loans.use: to buy handcrafts designed to carry fruits to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 25 years old and married with one child. He sells electrical goods to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years and has employed one person. He also does water vending and motorbike transport to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy DVDs and amplifiers to sell.

loans.use: to buy DVDs and amplifiers for sale

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She sells in a food stall and has been in business for three years. She is 28 year old, married and has two children; two of them are still in school. 

Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase onions and beans. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions and beans for sale

loans.name: Yep

texts.en:
Yep is 30 years old and a good mother of a lovely child living in the Batey district of Kompong Cham province. She is a local farmer who commonly grows rice alongside her husband (who also appeared in the photo). She is extremely competent and industrious in her business and she also devotes her spare time to raise a herd of ducks at home.

With the requested amount, she will use it to purchase feed for her ducks. She hopes that she’ll be able to make a good income from her business when her ducks become big enough for sale. Yep will save a part of her income to expand her future business, she said.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her ducks

loans.name: Ajoh

texts.en:
Ajoh lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for two years. She is 30 year old, married and has no children.
 
Ajoh heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Nyangang

texts.en:
Nyangang lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 39 year old, married and has five children; two of them are still in school. 

Nyangang heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Zeid

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 30-year-old youth client. He is married and has three children.

Zeid has been an owner of a mobile shop since 2009, selling mobile accessories and phones. He has more than three years experience in this field, has a good reputation, and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata est une jeune dame de 38ans qui fait du commerce depuis 10ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants .Elle se ravitaille au sud du Sénégal, en Casamance, ou elle achète de l’huile de palme, du miel, des pates d’arachides, du mil qu’elle revend chez elle ou elle compte beaucoup de clients. Avec le crédit elle va honorer  commande du quartier.
Fatoumata n’a pas de charges sinon qu’elle travaille pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle rêve de pouvoir avoir une plus grande capacité de fonctionnement.
texts.en:
Fatoumata, age 38, has been a merchant for ten years. She's married and the mother of three children.

She gets her supplies in Southern Senegal, usually in Casamance, where she buys palm oil, honey, peanut paste, and millet, that she resells in her town, where she has many customers.

Thanks to this loan, she will fulfill an order from the neighborhood. 

Fatoumata does not have fixed expenses to cover, and works in order to improve her family's standard of living. She dreams to be able to bolster her business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, honey, peanut paste, and millet

loans.name: Utamaduni Group

texts.en:
Happy is in her early 30s and single with three children. For the past year she has been selling hardware. Happy works daily from eight in the morning through six in the afternoon and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

Happy is requesting her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, that she will use to buy more pieces of wood, pipe, and iron sheets.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. 

Happy will share this loan with her group, "Utamaduni" which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.  (One member was talking on the telephone so only part of her body appears in this photo.)

loans.use: to buy  wood, pipe, and iron sheets.

loans.name: Ai

texts.en:
Ai is 70 years old and is a married woman who lives in the Batey district of Kompong Cham province. She has a life partner in her husband and the couple work together as rice farmers. Ai has five children, one of whom is married and has a new family. Two among her children are employed: her son works as a laborer in Korea and her daughter works for a garment factory in Phnom Penh city. Ai, together with her husband, usually plants rice twice a year because they can get enough water from the river during the rainy season.

Ai is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and machine lubricant for the upcoming farming season. This will be her first loan with with HKL as well as Kiva. Ai says that she will use the profit from her loan to support her younger daughter to become a hairdresser so that she’ll be able to have a livelihood and live independently and confidently.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and oil.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old and married to Monica, who contributes to the family income. He has been running his butchery for a period of about 10 years with an income of about 10,000 Kenyan shillings a month.

This is his second loan from KADET Ltd after successfully repaying the previous one. He will use the loan amount to buy a cow for slaughter. He hopes to open another butchery and improve his family living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for slaughter

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es:
Sadith de 30 años está casada con Carlos, el padre de sus 3 hijos de 12, 9 y 2 años de edad. Toda su familia vive unida en una casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado San Juan Centro Autiki, distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Sadith es una mujer ejemplar. Hace 10 años que empezó a dedicarse a la agricultura. En todo este tiempo y con la ayuda de su esposo han logrado conseguir 15 parcelas de terrenos distribuidas en distintas partes de su localidad. De las cuales en 10 produce café y en las 5 restantes plátanos y yucas.
“Por cada parcela cosecho 30 sacos de café, mi producción es bastante”, dice. 
Toda su cosecha la lleva con camiones que contrata para su traslado. Al mercado mayorista llegan compradores de cooperativas cafetaleras y de otras ciudades, quienes no dudan en pagar un precio justo por toda su producción. Con el dinero Sadith vuelve a invertir en más cultivos, de esa manera adquirió tantas parcelas. Ahora quiere mejorar su producción y dedicarse al cultivo de café orgánico que es más solicitado. Éste sería su crédito número 8 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuentas mensuales. “Flor de San Juan”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que se siente contenta por tener compañeros solidarios y responsables. Sadith, esta vez solicita el dinero para pagar los servicios de los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus cultivos de café de la maleza que siempre obstruye el crecimiento de sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Sadith is 30 years old, and she is married to Carlos.  He is the father of their three children, ages 12, 9, and 2.  The whole family lives together in their own house in the town of San Juan Centro Autiki in the Pichanaki district, Chanchamayo province.  

Sadith is an exemplary woman.  Ten years ago she started to devote herself to agriculture.  In all of this time, and with help from her husband, she has managed to obtain 15 parcels of land, which are distributed in different parts of her area.  She produces coffee on ten parcels, and on the five remaining parcels she produces bananas and yucca.

“For each parcel I harvest 30 sacks of coffee; my production is considerable,” she says.  She takes all of her harvest on trucks that she hires for their transport.  Buyers from coffee cooperatives and from other cities come to the wholesale market.  They do not hesitate to pay a fair price for her entire production.  Sadith turns the money around and invests in more crops.  This is the way she acquired so many parcels.

She now wants to improve her production and devote herself to growing organic coffee, which is in more demand. This will be her eighth loan with MF.  She pledges to be punctual with her monthly payments.  Flor de San Juan is the name of her communal bank.  She is happy to have supportive and responsible colleagues.

This time Sadith is requesting the loan to pay for the services of day laborers who will clear her coffee crops of the weeds that always obstruct the growth of these crops.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino de 53 años es un hombre soltero y sin hijos. Vive solo su casa propia ene l centro poblado San Juan Centro Autiki, distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo.
Saturnino llegó a la comunidad San Juan hace 17 años. Él es de Andahuaylas (sierra sur del Perú). Sus hermanos tenían terrenos en ese entonces. Por esa razón dejó su tierra natal. Ahora cuenta con terrenos propios en los que cultiva café y cítricos como naranjas y limones. 
Cuando dispone tiempo, los fines de semana trabaja como jornalero en otras parcelas. Saturnino es un hombre constante y trabajador por naturaleza. Su agitada vida le impidió encontrar una mujer como compañera y madre de sus hijos. A pesar de eso, está contento con su desempeño.
Así también trabaja en una entidad pública como encargado de instalaciones de agua potable y mantenimiento, con eso obtiene ingresos mensuales seguros.
Saturnino se siente libre laborando en sus cultivos, por eso continuará invirtiendo en esta actividad. Éstes ería su crédito número 8 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete a pagar las cuotas puntualmente. Además da a conocer su satisfacción de pertenecer al banco comunal “Flor de San Juan”, por tener compañeros responsables como él. Con el dinero del préstamo pagará el arriendo de los terrenos que cultiva. Así también comprará canastas y machetes para la cosecha; ya pagará a los jornaleros que realizarán estas tareas.
texts.en:
Saturnino is a 53 year old single man with no children. He lives alone in his own house in San Juan Centro Autiki in the Pichanaki district, Chanchamayo province. 
Saturnino came to San Juan 17 years ago. He is from Andahuaylas (mountains at the south of Perú). His siblings had land here.  For this reason, he left his home. Now he has his own land where he grows coffee and citrus fruits like oranges and lemons. When he arranges his time, he works as a laborer on other plots of land. Saturnino is a persevering and hard-working man for nature. His hectic life prevented him from finding a woman to be a companion and mother of his children. In spite of this, he is happy with his situation. 
He also works for a public institution as manager for potable water installation and maintenance. With this work, he earns a secure monthly income. 
Saturnino feels free working on his crops. For this reason, he will continue to invest in this work. This will be his eighth loan with MFP. He promises to make his payments on time. In addition, he gets satisfaction from belonging to the “Flor de San Juan” communal bank because the members are responsible like him. With the loan money, he will pay for the renting of the land he farms. He will also buy baskets and machetes for the harvest. He will pay the laborers who do this work.

loans.use: hire laborers and purchase baskets & machetes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his business like painting and adding restrooms and make his business more attractive to customers.

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en:
Nyiel lives in Bor. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married and has four children, two of them are still in school. 
Nyiel heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.
.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Amuor

texts.en:
Amuor lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 40 years old, married and has six children. Two of them are still in school. 
Amuor heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1200 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is 32 years old and married with one child. He runs a beauty salon to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has employed two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a hair blow drying machine and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow drying machine and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Ayen

texts.en:
Ayen lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 34 years old, married and has four children. Two of the children are still in school. 
Ayen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Muhannad

texts.en:
Mohannad is a 38 year old young man. He is a father with one son and two daughters. He works in agriculture, but it is not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past two years, he has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project.

Mohannad is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep, and in the future he is looking to build up a herd which will be a suitable place to raise sheep. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.  Mohannad is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase additional number of sheep.

loans.name: Maria Gilma

texts.es:
Maria es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y dedicada al cuidado de sus 2 hijos. Maria es una madre soltera cabeza de familia debido a que el padre de sus hijos la abandonó hace un tiempo. Maria anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa de confección donde aprendió a realizar muy bien el oficio pero debido a que su trabajo era muy mal remunerado decidió independizarse, comprar 2 máquinas para confeccionar y prestar el servicio de confección a terceros. Gracias a la buena calidad del servicio que ofrece Maria, ha podido tener una gran cantidad de clientes, lo que le permite tener buenos niveles de trabajo que le garantizan los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus 2 hijas. Debido a que un cliente le ha hecho la propuesta de brindarle unos pedidos superiores, los cuales requieren de una máquina que Maria no posee, busca que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de una máquina recubridora la cual le permita aceptar el trabajo de un cliente y poder generar mayores ingresos para su hogar. 

Maria espera que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues tendrá mayor volumen de trabajo. Maria sueña con que su taller crezca y se convierta en una microempresa que genere empleo para personas muy necesitadas y que no han encontrado oportunidades laborales. Además, Maria espera sacar sus 2 hijos adelante brindándoles estudio y quiere heredarle el taller de confección a su hija mayor la cual muestra interés en la actividad.
texts.en:
Maria is a person who has characterized herself as being very hardworking and dedicated to caring for her two children. Maria is a single mother head of household since the father of her children abandoned her some time ago. Before, Maria worked for a clothing manufacturing business where she learned to perform her job well but since the work was very poorly compensated she decided to become independent, buy two sewing machines and provide a third-party sewing service. 

Thanks to the good quality of the service she offers, she has been able to have a great number of customers, which allows her to have a good level of work that guarantees her the necessary income to support her two daughters. Since a client has proposed granting her some superior orders, which require a machine that Maria doesn't have, she is looking for a loan that will allow her to buy a coverstitch machine so she can accept the job from the client and be able to generate greater income for her home.

Maria expects that her income will grow considerably, as she will have a greater volume of work. Maria dreams that her workshop will grow and turn into a small business that generates employment for people in need who haven't found opportunities for work. Furthermore, Maria hopes to get her two children ahead, give them an education, and leave her sewing workshop to her older daughter who shows interest in the work.

loans.use: to buy a coverstitch machine that will allow her to accept a job from a client and be able to generate more income for her home.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina es una persona que ha tenido la característica de ser muy trabajadora y siempre buscar un mayor bienestar para su familia. Luz Marina se dedica desde hace aproximadamente 30 años a la actividad del corte y cepillado del cabello, y gracias a esto contribuye con su esposo a los ingresos para su hogar. Luz Marina tiene un salón de belleza el cual es muy reconocido en su sector por el buen servicio que ofrece, y esto le ha permitido captar una gran cantidad de clientes. Luz Marina quiere ofrecer en su salón de belleza, además del servicio del corte y cepillado del cabello, la venta de productos de belleza a sus clientes. Es por esto que Luz Marina aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal como shampoo, cremas, tinturas, cosméticos, entre otros y poder ofrecer a sus clientes además del servicio de corte y cepillado del cabello, la venta de productos de belleza.

Luz Marina espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá captar más clientela y atraer mayores ventas en su negocio. Luz Marina sueña con que su salón de belleza crezca y pueda emplear a personas que requieran de unos ingresos y no hayan tenido oportunidades laborales, además, de poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a person who has had the characteristic of being very hardworking and always looks to improve her family's wellbeing. Luz Marina has devoted herself to cutting and styling hair for approximately 30 years, thanks to which she contributes along with her husband to her household's income. Luz Marina has a beauty salon which is very well known in the area for the good service offered there, which has allowed her to attract a great number of customers. In addition to the services of cutting and styling hair, Luz Marina wants to offer beauty products for sale to her customers at her salon. Therefore Luz Marina is hoping a loan will allow her the opportunity to purchase personal use products such as shampoo, creams, hair dyes, and cosmetics, among other items, for selling to her customers so she may offer them beauty products in addition to the cutting and styling services. 

Luz Marina hopes that in this way her income may increase considerably, since she will be able to attract more customers and have better sales in her business. Luz Marina dreams of her business growing and that she might hire people who need an income, who have not had work opportunities, as well as being able to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase personal use products such as shampoo, creams, hair dyes, and cosmetics among other items, so that in addition to cutting and styling hair for her customers she may also offer them beauty products.

loans.name: Olimkhon

texts.ru: Олимхон умный и трудолюбивый парень. Он занимается купле-продажей продуктов питания, а также изготовлением шашлыка. Его бизнес находится в автостанции на видном многолюдном месте. Имеет пятилетний опыт в данном бизнесе и является собственником бизнеса. Мать помогает по бизнесу. Начинал бизнес с услугой компьютерных игр, а затем перешел в торговлю. Олимхон запрашивает займ для покупки сладостей с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Olimkhon is an intelligent, hardworking young man. He is in business retailing groceries, as well as making "shashlyk" or shish-kebabs. His business is located in a bus station in a visible area where there are always many people. Olimkhon has five years of experience doing this and owns his business. His mother helps him with the business. He got his start in business providing computer gaming services, then moved on to retail. Olimkhon has requested a loan to purchase sweets (candy and cookies) to expand his business. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy sweets in order to expand his business

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin is 26 years old.  He is a young and very enthusiastic man.  He is married and has two sons. 

Elvin sells fruits and vegetables and also grows part of them in his garden. He has been doing this for the last 5 years. He is a very experienced farmer and has deep knowledge of land and how to operate it.
 
Elvin usually raises seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar. Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and are in high demand because people prefer to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. Also one of the favorite national dishes, Dolma,  is made from fresh eggplants, peppers and tomatoes. His monthly income from this business is 320 AZN. This is only one source of income for his family.

Elvin would like to invest more capital into his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers as well as more fruits and vegetables to sell. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.  He hopes this loan will improve life for his family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Don Gregorio tiene 72 años, es casado, tiene 7 hijos los cuales todos son mayores de edad y 5 de ellos viven en el extranjero, el vive junto con su esposa en la Aldea La Cruz, Morazán, Yoro.
Don Gregorio se dedica a la ganadería específicamente la producción de leche. Esta actividad ha sido su fuente de ingreso desde hace 55 años. Inicio con 3 reses que le heredero su padre, empezó a trabajar y ha generar dinero. logrando buenas ganancias, que la han permitido invertir en la compra de más cabezas de reses para aumentar la producción.  La leche la vende en litros a las comunidades vecinas. Este negocio le ha sido muy rentable porque los ingresos son constantes. Y con mucho trabajo y dedicación ha logrado mantenerlo dedicándole 8 horas diarias.
Don Gregorio ha solicitado un préstamo de 21,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en la compra de una cabeza de res para seguir aumentando la producción de leche. 
Su plan es crecer más en el negocio de la ganadería.
texts.en:
Don Gregorio is 72 years old, married, and has seven children who are grown. Five of them live abroad. He lives with his wife in the neighborhood of La Cruz, Morazán, Yoro.

Don Gregorio raises livestock, specifically dairy cattle. This activity has been his source of income for the past 55 years. He started out with three heads of cattle that he inherited from his father and began working in order to earn money. Gregorio achieved good earnings, which allowed him to invest in the purchase of more cattle so that he could increase production. The milk is sold by the liter in the neighboring communities. His business has been very profitable because the income is constant. With much effort and dedication, he continues to work eight hours a day.

Don Gregorio is requesting a loan of 21,000 HNL to invest in the purchase of a head of cattle so that he can continue increasing his milk production. His plan is to grow his livestock business even more.

loans.use: to buy a head of dairy cattle.

loans.name: Anorkhon

texts.ru: Анорхон замужем, она трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Последние годы она занимается купле- продажей кондитерских изделий. Она сама является владельцем бизнеса и начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды, потом перешла на продажу хлебобулочных изделий и вот уже 5 лет торгует кондитерскими изделиями. Также дома имеет крупный рогатый скот. Муж занимается скотоводством. Анорхон запрашивает займ для приобретения кондитерских изделий для расширения ассортимента.
texts.en: Anorkhon is married and a hardworking and kind woman. In the recent years, she has been buying and selling confectionery products.  She is the owner of her business.  She started it by selling children's clothes, then bakery products,  and has now been selling confectionery goods for 5 years.  At home, she also owns cattle.  Her husband is involved in animal husbandry.  Anorkhon is requesting a loan to purchase confectionery products in order to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.use: to purchase confectionery products.

loans.name: Olmakhon

texts.ru:
Олмахон 30 лет, замужем, имеет троих детей - 1 сына и 2 дочери. Олмахон на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS).  Благодаря упорному труду Олмахон в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 лошади, 12 коров, 5 телят, 20 овец и 10 коз, принося ежемесячно около 8,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока и молочных продуктов.  Также, семья Олмахон ежегодно обрабатывает  1 га земли, где сеют кукурузу, пшеницу и картофель, получая прибыль в сезон. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Олмахон обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку телят и овец – молодняка. Доходы от кредита Олмахон планирует вложить в закуп строительных материалов для дома.
texts.en: Olmakhon is 30 years old, married and has three children - one son and two daughters.  Olmakhon has been involved in animal husbandry for 15 years, after starting this business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her persistent work, today her business has two horses, twelve cows, five calves, twenty sheep and ten goats, and yields about 8,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and milk products.  Also, Olmakhon's family yearly works on 1 hectare of land, where they sow corn, wheat and potatoes, and obtain a profit during the season.  In order to further develop her business, Olmakhon requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy calves and sheep - young animals.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into buying construction materials for her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Norberto Antonio

texts.es:
Norberto es una persona que ha tenido que superar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo sus ganas de trabajar le han permitido seguir adelante junto con su familia. Anteriormente Norberto trabajaba como transportador para una empresa, lo que hacía, por los largos viajes que debía realizar, que no tuviera mucho contacto con su familia, y esto lo desmotivaba mucho. Además de esto, la situación de orden público se puso delicada durante un tiempo, lo que hizo que tuviera que abandonar su actividad como transportador y buscar otras alternativas para generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Desde allí, Norberto montó un bar donde ofrece snack, gaseosas y licor a sus clientes, además de que tiene un billar. Gracias a esta actividad, Norberto puede generar los ingresos necesarios para su esposa y su hijo y poder compartir con ellos mucho más tiempo. Norberto, debido a que montó su negocio con muy bajos recursos económicos, aún tiene que comprar algunos implementos que le permitan ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes. Es por esto que Norberto espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un refrigerador donde pueda almacenar los licores y las gaseosas y ofrecerlas en un mejor estado a sus clientes.

Norberto espera poder acceder a este refrigerador sin que sus ingresos mensuales se vean afectados, y de esta manera pueda seguir ofreciendo a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Norberto sueña con que su negocio se consolide y sea reconocido por muchos más clientes, y de esta manera pueda tener grandes ventas que le permitan generar empleo para las personas más vulnerables de su región. Además, Norberto sueña con que su negocio le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de su casa propia.
texts.en:
Norberto es a person that has had to overcome much adversity in his life. However his desire to work has enabled to him to move forward together with his family. Before Norberto worked as a carrier for a business which made for long journey to be undertaken. He didn't have much contact with his family and this discouraged him a lot. After this, the situation of public order was delicate for a time, which meant he had to abandon his job as a carrier and look for other alternatives to generate the necessary income to sustain the expenses of the household. Since then, Norberto set up a bar where he serves snacks, soda, and liquor to his customers. Additionally he has a pool table. Thanks to this work, Norberto can generate the necessary income for his wife and son and is able to spend much more time with them. Norberto, forced to set up his business with very little economic resources, he still had to purchase supplies that allowed him to offer a good service to his customers. It is for this that Norberto hopes that a loan provides him with the opportunity of accessing the purchase of a refrigerator where he can store the liquor and soda and offer them in a better state to his customers.

Norberto hopes that he is able to access this refrigerator without seeing his monthly income affected and in this way he is able to continue offering a good quality of life to his family. Norberto dreams of consolidating his business and being known by many customers and in this way be able to have bigger sales that allow him to generate employment for those most vulnerable in the region. Additionally, Norberto dreams of his business providing him the opportunity of accessing the purchase of his own home.

loans.use: to purchase a refridgerator where he can store the liquors and sodas and offer them in a better state to his clients.

loans.name: Abuk

texts.en:
Abuk lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 39 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are still in school. 

Abuk heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.ru: Сафия женщина в возрасте 61 года, мать двоих сыновей.Ее сыновья уехали на заработки в России. Она занимается выращиванием  скота вместе с внуком. Проживает в отдалённом кишлаке, вблизи гор. Сафия имеет шесть баранов и одну корову, для которых у неё закончился корм и сено. Для закупки нескольких мешков корма она решила получить кредит. На снимке она на месте деятельности.
texts.en: Safiya is a 61 year-old woman, who is a mother of two sons.  Her sons left to work in Russia.  She is involved in fattening up livestock together with her grandson.  She lives alone in a distant village near mountains.  Safiya has six sheep and one cow and has run out of feed and hay for them.  She decided to obtain this loan to buy several bags of feed.  The photograph shows her at her place of business.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mamadou, surnommé Vieux par ces proches est un jeune menuisier  de 39 ans. Marié et père d’un enfant. Il a une expérience de 9 ans dans le domaine de la menuiserie. C’est un habitué de la caisse puisqu’ il vient de solder trois crédits sans difficulté. Ce dernier qu’il emprunte va lui servir à acheter du bois, à le transformer en meubles et à le revendre à des particuliers.
Mamadou a comme charges  de payer les frais de scolarité de son enfant et de gérer la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. Dans l’avenir il aimerait acheter de nouvelles machines pour  augmenter son exploitation.
texts.en: Mamadou, nicknamed Vieux [old] by those close to him is a young 39 year old carpenter. He is married and father to one child. He has 9 years experience in carpentry. He is a regular of the branch because he has just settled three loans without difficulty. This last one that he is borrowing will allow him to buy wood, transform it into furniture and resell it to customers. Mamadou has the responsibility of paying his child's school fees and managing his family's daily expenses. In the future he would like to buy new machines to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture to resell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y siempre buscar un bienestar para su familia. Luz Marina se encuentra casada y es madre de 1 hijo, quienes es la motivación para trabajar fuertemente todos los días. Luz Marina inició su negocio de venta de comidas desde hace aproximadamente 7 años, y gracias a este ha podido contribuir a su esposo con los ingresos del hogar. Luz Marina es reconocida en el sector gracias al buen servicio que ofrece y la buena sazón de sus comidas. Debido a que en el local donde actualmente tiene su negocio de comidas se encuentra en un periodo donde requiere hacerle un poco de mantenimiento, Luz Marina aspira que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a pintar el local donde ofrece sus comidas y a surtir su negocio con insumos que requiere para la preparación de sus comidas.

Luz Marina espera que su negocio se vea más atractivo para los clientes y de esta manera pueda generar mayores ventas. Luz Marina sueña con que su esposo y su hijo puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y tengan mayores oportunidades de progresar económicamente. Luz Marina también sueña con que su negocio crezca y se convierta en un gran restaurante el cual pueda generar mucho empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Luz Marina has characterized herself as a very hardworking person who always looks out for the well-being of her family. Luz Marina is married and the mother of 1 son, who is the motivation for working hard every day. Luz Marina started her food service business approximately 7 years ago, and thanks to this she has been able to contribute, along with her husband, to the household income. Luz Marina is recognized in her area thanks to the good service she offers, and the good flavoring of her food. 

Since the location where she currently has her food service business finds itself in a period where doing some maintenance is required, Luz Marina has aspirations that a loan will provide her with the opportunity to be able to paint the location where she sells her food, and supply her business with the provisions that she requires for the preparation of her dishes.

Luz Marina hopes that her business will be seen as more attractive by her customers, and in this way generate greater sales. Luz Marina dreams that her husband and her child can have a better quality of life, and more opportunities to progress financially. Luz Marina also dreams that her business will grow and become a large restaurant which will be able to generate a lot of employment for people in need.

loans.use: to paint her food service location and supply her business with provisions that she requires for making the dishes.

loans.name: Ikhlass

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children.

Ikhlass has been a tailor since 2008. She professionally makes, repairs, or alters clothing such as suits, coats, and dresses for women. She has more than four years of experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She decided to apply for a $1,800 loan in order to rent a shop. She is aiming to gain more profits to improve her family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: to rent a shop.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  d’une soixantaine d’années. Elle est divorcée et mère de 2 enfants  de  24 et 27 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 3 ans. Elle vend des jus, de la glace et de l’huile de palme. Avant de se lancer dans le commerce elle  était employée comme femme de ménage dans une clinique de la place. Aussi cette activité de commerce  elle l’a choisi par passion. Et ce qui l’intéresse  le plus dans cette affaire  ce sont les profits qu’elle gagne.  Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2002.  Elle a déjà remboursé  5 prêts antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de savon en poudre qu’elle compte revendre a sa clientèle. Son objectif est de renforcer son fond de roulement  et de diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise. Elle souhaite accroitre ses revenus et participer a l’amélioration de la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madam Fatou lives in Sénégal. She is around 60 years old. She is divorced and mother to 2 children who are 24 and 27 years old. She has been advancing in business for more than 3 years. She sells juice, ice and palm oil. Before going into business she was employed as a cleaner in a local clinic. Also, she chose this business out of passion. And what interests her the most in this business are the profits that she makes. 

She has been a member of one of the branches of the UIMCEC since May 2002. She has already repaid 5 previous loans with the institution. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 frs to buy powdered soap which she plans to resell to her clientèle. Her goal is to strengthen her working capital and to diversify the products that she sells. She hopes to grow her income and participate in bettering the social conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy powdered soap to resell.

loans.name: Aloung

texts.en:
Aloung lives in Bor. She sells fish and has been in business for three years. She is 39 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are still in school. 

Aloung heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 47 years old, single, and lives with his family.

Mohamad has been an owner of a shop since 1991, selling spare parts for cars. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Madame Maty  est âgée  de 44 ans. Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 13 et 20 ans. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle vend des tissus et chaussures et divers autres articles. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2001. Elle a déjà remboursé 5 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour  s’approvisionner en tissus et chaussures pour les besoins de son commerce. Son objectif est d’accroitre les bénéfices qu’elle gagne pour pouvoir participer à l’amélioration des conditions sociales de sa famille.
texts.en: Madam Maty is 44 years old. She lives in Sénégal. She is married and mother to 3 children whose age varies between 13 and 20 years old. She has been in business for more than 20 years. She sells fabric and shoes and other diverse items. She has been a member of one of the branches of the UIMCEC since November 2001. She has already repaid 5 previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 200,000 frs to stock up in fabric and shoes for the needs of her business. Her goal is to grow the profits that she makes to be able to participate in improving the social conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Leidy Yuliana

texts.es:
Leidy es una joven emprendedora que desde muy temprana edad decidió montar su negocio con el ánimo de generar sus propios ingresos y contribuir en hogar con los ingresos para el sostenimiento de los gastos. Leidy se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama, actividad la cual le ha permitido generar ingresos para su hogar, además de poder pagarse sus propios estudios. Los clientes de Leidy son las personas del sector, quienes reconocen que el negocio de Leidy ofrece una muy buena calidad en sus productos y una muy buena atención. Debido a que sus clientes le han hecho muchos pedidos de que venda ropa interior, Leidy aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de ropa interior para aumentar en su negocio la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Leidy espera que sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de mercancía a sus clientes. Leidy sueña con que su negocio crezca y pueda tener su propio almacén y sacar la venta de ropa de su casa y ubicarla en un buen local donde sea más atractiva para los clientes. Leidy también sueña con poder generar empleo para las personas que más requieren de unos ingresos y poder seguir aportando en su hogar para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Leidy is a young entrepreneur who at an early age decided to create a business in the spirit of generating her own income, contributing to convering expenses and sustaining her income. Leidy sells women's clothing, an activity that has permitted her to generate income for her home, plus pay for her own studies. Leidy's customers are local people who recognize that her business offers products of good quality and very attentive service. Her customers have ordered lots of underwear, and Leidy hopes that a loan will provide the opportunity to purchase more underwear and build her business by expanding the variety of products she can offer her customers. 

Leidy hopes to increase her income considerably, enabling her to offer customers a greater variety of merchandise. She dreams of expanding her business and having her own store, transferring clothing sales from her house to a good shop that will be more attractive for her customers. Leidy also dreams of being able to generate employment for people who need some income, and of continuing to contribute to her home so that her family may enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy underwear to augment the product variety she offers her customers in her business.

loans.name: Agueda Marina

texts.es:
La señora Agueda Marina de 57 años de edad, tiene 32 años de estar juntos con su pareja con quien ha tenido 3 hijas de 22, 25 y 29 años de edad y vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.
Doña Agueda, motivada por darle el estudio a sus hijas, hace 6 años decidió establecer una pulpería con sus propios esfuerzos, donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar(granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, lácteos, maíz, embutidos, churros, abarroterías, achinerías, refrescos, carnes etc. el negocio lo mantiene abierto todo el día para atender bien a sus clientes.
Ella está solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF, el cual es por 20,000.00 Lempiras, una parte la va invertir en comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lápices, y otra parte la invertirá en la pulpería para mantenerla surtida. El préstamo anterior le ayudo mucho a incrementar el inventario y a mejorar los ingresos. Su meta es continuar trabajando para tener un nivel económico mejor.
texts.en:
Sra. Agueda Marina is 57 years old. She and her partner have been together for 32 years. They have three daughters (ages 22, 25, and 29) and live in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.

Doña Agueda was motivated to provide her daughters with an education. Six years ago, she decided to establish a store through her own efforts so that she could sell basic household products (such as basic grains, sugar, lard, dairy products, corn, sausages, fried dough, knickknacks, soft drinks, meats, and other items). Her business stays open every day so that she can provide good service to her customers.

Agueda is requesting her second loan from ODEF in the amount of 20,000 HNL. Part of the loan will be invested in school supplies such as notebooks and pencils, and the other part will be invested in food products so that she can remain well-stocked. Her previous loan was a great help in increasing her inventory and improving her income. Her goal is to continue working so that she can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to restock her business with food products and school supplies.

loans.name: Atheer

texts.en:
This borrower, age 26, has owned a shoe store since 2007. He sells a well-rounded variety of men's, women's, and children's shoes. He has considerable experience in his business and a strong understanding of his local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for the store as well as to repair the ceiling and erect an advertising light box. His goal is to gain more profits in order to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole. 

He and his wife have two children.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the store as well as to repair the ceiling and erect an advertising light box

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer, age 39, lives in Langber Bor. She sells fish, and has been in this business for three years. She and her husband have four children, two of whom are still in school.
